semantic_title: 7th Characters: Requirements and Positioning Rules for Code Completion

content.full_text: Certain ICD-10-CM categories have applicable 7th characters. The applicable 7th character is required for all codes within the category, or as the notes in the Tabular List instruct. The 7th character must always be the 7th character in the data field. If a code that requires a 7th character is not 6 characters, a placeholder X must be used to fill in the empty characters. (Evidence: pg no: 8, L32-L37)
content.summary: Establishes requirements for 7th characters including positioning rules and use of placeholder X when needed (Evidence: pg no: 8, L32-L37)
key_concepts: Certain categories have applicable 7th characters (Evidence: pg no: 8, L33)
7th character required for all codes in applicable categories (Evidence: pg no: 8, L33-L34)
7th character must be in 7th position (Evidence: pg no: 8, L35)
Placeholder X used when code is less than 6 characters (Evidence: pg no: 8, L36-L37)

detailed_rules.rule_text: The applicable 7th character is required for all codes within the category, or as the notes in the Tabular List instruct (Evidence: pg no: 8, L33-L34)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a category has 7th character requirements, all codes within that category must include the appropriate 7th character (Evidence: pg no: 8, L33-L34)

detailed_rules.rule_text: The 7th character must always be the 7th character in the data field (Evidence: pg no: 8, L35)
detailed_rules.explanation: The 7th character must occupy the 7th position regardless of the base code length (Evidence: pg no: 8, L35)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If a code that requires a 7th character is not 6 characters, a placeholder X must be used to fill in the empty characters (Evidence: pg no: 8, L36-L37)
detailed_rules.explanation: Placeholder X characters must be inserted to ensure the 7th character appears in the correct position (Evidence: pg no: 8, L36-L37)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if code requires 7th character
Step 2: Count characters in base code
Step 3: Add placeholder X if code is less than 6 characters
Step 4: Add appropriate 7th character in 7th position

coding_scenarios.scenario: Fracture code requiring 7th character with placeholder X
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Closed fracture of unspecified part of neck of right femur, initial encounter
step_by_step: Step 1: Locate code S72.001 (fracture of unspecified part of neck of right femur)
Step 2: Note this is 6 characters, no X needed
Step 3: Add 7th character A for initial encounter

correct_coding.rationale: 7th character A properly positioned in 7th position (Evidence: pg no: 8, L35)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Short code requiring placeholder X for 7th character positioning
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Poisoning by penicillin, accidental, initial encounter
step_by_step: Step 1: Locate code T36.0 (poisoning by penicillins)
Step 2: Note this is only 5 characters
Step 3: Add placeholder X to reach 6 characters

correct_coding.rationale: Placeholder X used to position 7th character correctly (Evidence: pg no: 8, L36-L37)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Missing placeholder X, 7th character not in correct position
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Not using placeholder X when code is less than 6 characters

breakdown.S72.001A: 6-character base code, 7th character A in position 7 (Evidence: pg no: 8, L35)
breakdown.T36.0X1A: 5-character base code, X placeholder, then 7th character A in position 7 (Evidence: pg no: 8, L36-L37)

examples.rationale: 7th character must always be in 7th position regardless of base code length (Evidence: pg no: 8, L35-L37)

common_mistakes: Not using placeholder X when needed
tips: 7th character requirements are indicated in Tabular List

implementation_notes: 7th character positioning is critical for code validity
